title: Minister Lamamra meets in Addis Ababa with several officials from Europe and Australia
text: The Minister of Foreign Affairs and the National Community Abroad, Mr. Ramtane Lamamra had, Saturday in Addis Ababa, talks with officials from Europe and Australia as part of his participation in the work of the African Union Summit (AU) as part of the delegation led by the Prime Minister, AÃ¯mene Benabderrahmane in his capacity as representative of the President of the Republic, Mr. Abdelmadjid Tebboune.
Mr.Lamamra had meetings with the Portuguese Prime Minister, Antonio Costa, the President of the European Council, Charles Michel and the Australian Deputy Foreign Minister, Tim Watts.
Mr. Lamamra discussed with the Portuguese Prime Minister the Algerian-Portuguese relations and their promising prospects.
Mr. Costa affirmed that he aspires to participate personally in the upcoming events between the two countries linked by the Treaty of Friendship, Good Neighborliness and Cooperation since 2005.

With the President of the European Council, Charles Michel, Mr. Lamamra discussed issues related to the partnership between Algeria and the European Union (EU) and ways to strengthen it in accordance with the principle of balance of interests.

Mr. Lamamra agreed with the Australian Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Tim Watts, to mutually support the candidacies of both countries in international organizations to which they belong and exchanged views on the situation prevailing in the Sahel-Saharan region.
